cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning northwest then north, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then up the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City/Intracoastal City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle; Intracoastal City to Cameron.  Tropical Storm Watch: East of the Mouth of Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle.  Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of Pearl River to Grand Isle, including Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas and Intracoastal City to Cameron.  Storm Surge Warning: Intracoastal City to Biloxi including Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast with greatest impacts along the Louisiana shoreline; lesser impacts possible along the upper Texas coast including Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (outer rain-bands could bring 4 inches or more)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (surge guidance focuses east of the TX/LA line)
weather_observation.wind: 20–35 kt winds possible; 27 % chance of sustained ≥34 kt, gusts to tropical-storm force in squalls Saturday–Saturday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding 1–2 ft above ground level possible around Sabine Pass at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 2–5 inches of rain with higher local amounts in heavy squalls Saturday through Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands cannot be ruled out
